title: Population of regions in England in 2018
summary: This is a bar chart representing Region in the x axis and Number of inhabitants (in millions) in the y axis.
The Number of inhabitants (in millions) is highest at Region South East and lowest at Region North East.
The difference of Number of inhabitants (in millions) between the highest and lowest Region is 6.47.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Region in the x axis and Number of inhabitants (in millions) in the y axis.
The Number of inhabitants (in millions) is highest at Region South East and lowest at Region North East.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Region in the x axis and Number of inhabitants (in millions) in the y axis.
The Number of inhabitants (in millions) is highest at Region South East and lowest at Region North East.
The difference of Number of inhabitants (in millions) between the highest and lowest Region is 6.47.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Number of inhabitants (in millions) for 9 number of Regions.
The Number of inhabitants (in millions) is highest at Region South East and lowest at Region North East.
There is a difference of 6.47 between the maximum Region South East and minimum Region North East.
Number of inhabitants (in millions) at Region South East is 9.13 , second place is London at 8.9, and thirdly is North West at 7.29.
The highest value 9.13 at South East is almost 1.47 times larger than the average value 6.21.
Summing up the values of all Regions, we get total 55.92.
